result.execSummary:
The defendant Larry Gardner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Kenosha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Credit days may be submitted by stip and order.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Counseling shall specifically include:  Anger management / DV counseling.  AODA Assessment and follow through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
May not have contact with Brenda Gardner, Gina Richardson, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

State of Wisconsin appears by ADA Andrew Burgoyne. DE appears in custody with Atty Gregory Reed. Victim present in court.  Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  259 -   Victim rights compliance. Matter is resolved. DE enters plea of no contest to Cts 4, 7 - found guilty by the Court. All remaining counts dismissed and read-in. PSI waived. Sentence recommendations. Victim statement. Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 2 years w/conditions.  Credit days may be submitted by stip and order. No contact with Gina R. or Brenda G. Court costs ordered.  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given. Firearms warning, Voters rights, Appeal rights given.
to Reduce Bail and Modify Bond filed by Atty Reed

Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State. DE appears in custody with Atty Gregory Reed.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  1042 - Atty Reed is new to these cases, though complete files have not yet been rec'd. Atty Reed requests DE be housed in Racine Co. Jail, as opposed to Kenosha Co. Court will make no specific order as to where the DE is housed - defense counsel may contact KSD for any possible arrangements. If an agreement is reached between KSD, DA, and DE, an order may be drafted and submitted for Court's review. Discovery is available to DE by DA's office, though Atty Reed is responsible for collecting the discovery from the DA's office. Court reviews proper collection procedure with defense counsel. Demands to be filed by Atty Reed. DE requests new counsel. Parties meet privately. Case recalled at 1139. DE withdraws request for new counsel and demands speedy jury trial on 13CF1104. Atty Reed shall submit bond motion in writing, hearing scheduled.  Motion hearing scheduled for November 22, 2016 at 02:30 pm.  Status conference scheduled for January 26, 2017 at 01:00 pm.
from Atty Gregory Reed to the Court

Attorney Tom Binger appeared for the State.  Atty Diane Caspari appeared on behalf of the defendant, who did not appear.  Clerk/S. Garcia.  Atty Caspari does not have an explanation for the defendant's non-appearance.  The court forfeits the bond and issues a bench warrant in the amount of $15,000.00.  Per Judge Kerkman, the court commissioner may not modify the bond.

DE is now present in court at 9:14 AM and with Atty Caspari.  DE states he thought court was at 9:00 AM.   Bench warrant is vacated; not yet issued.  Court increases DE 's bond in 13CF1104.  Due to another trial already in progress new trial dates are given to parties.  Case continues to trail 13CF1104 & 13CF1129.  Status Conf. on July 7, 2016 at 01:00 pm and on July 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant is now present in court with his attorney at 9:14 AM stating he overslept due to work and school.  Court increases DE's bond to a $1500 Cash Bond so DE must post an additional $750 Cash before 5 PM or report to the KCJ if unable to post by 5 PM.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Diane Caspari.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Defense motion to withdraw guilty plea is granted.  All counts in this file that were previously dismissed are reinstated.  Files that were dismissed as part of the plea agreement (14-CF-1352, 14-CF-906, 13-CF-1104, and 13-CF-1129) are reopened and orders of dismissal are vacated.  Bonds in the files that had been dismissed are reinstated with same conditions.  Status conf. on all files 1/8/16 at 11:00.  Bonds continued.
